Case Study: Robust temporal map of human in vitro myelopoiesis using single-cell genomics

Kayla Interdonanto

Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center
Kayla.Morrell@RoswellPark.org

1 November 2022

Source: vignettes/hca-ac289b77-fb12-4a6b-ad43-c0721c698e70.Rmd
hca-ac289b77-fb12-4a6b-ad43-c0721c698e70.Rmd

Setup

Load useful packages

library(HCACaseStudies)
library(hca)
library(dplyr)
library(Seurat)

Project information

Set the project id

project_id <- "ac289b77-fb12-4a6b-ad43-c0721c698e70"

Display information about the project

project_information(project_id)
## Title
##   Robust temporal map of human in vitro myelopoiesis using single-cell
##   genomics
## Contributors (unknown order; any role)
##   Carla,P,Jones, David,F,Tough, Gosia Trynka, Daniel,J,Gaffney,
##   Beata,S,Wyspianska, Maria Nascimento Primo, Andrew Bassett, Ami Day,
##   Clara Alsinet, Andrew,J,Knights, Valentina Lorenzi, Damiana
##   Alvarez-Errico, Erica Bello, Iva Kelava, Roser Vilarrasa-Blasi,
##   Jong-Eun Park, Roser Vento-Tormo, Carmen Sancho-Serra
## Description
##   Myeloid cells are central to homeostasis and immunity. Characterising
##   in vitro myelopoiesis protocols is imperative for their use in
##   research, immunotherapies, and understanding human myelopoiesis. The
##   authors generated a >470K cells molecular map of human induced
##   pluripotent stem cells (iPSC) differentiation into macrophages.
##   Integration with in vivo single-cell atlases showed in vitro
##   differentiation recapitulates features of yolk sac hematopoiesis,
##   before definitive hematopoietic stem cells (HSC) emerge. The
##   diversity of myeloid cells generated, including mast cells and
##   monocytes, suggests that HSC-independent hematopoiesis can produce
##   multiple myeloid lineages.
## DOI
##   10.1038/s41467-022-30557-4
## URL
##   https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-022-30557-4
## Project
##   https://data.humancellatlas.org/explore/projects/ac289b77-fb12-4a6b-ad43-c0721c698e70

Conventions

Statistics calculated locally use local.* for column names, e.g., local.cellCount.

Data processing

Project & samples

Create a filter to identify the project

project_filter <- filters(projectId = list(is = project_id))

Find the project

p <- projects(project_filter, as = "tibble_expanded")
p |> glimpse()

Samples associated with the project

s <- samples(project_filter, as = "tibble_expanded")

Columns are either variable and therefore describe sample-level information…

## informative 'specimen' or 'donorOrganisms' columns
s |>
    select(starts_with("specimens") | starts_with("donorOrganisms")) |>
    select(where(column_is_informative)) |>
    glimpse()
## Rows: 92
## Columns: 7
## $ specimens.id                     <list> "human_skin_kolf_2", "human_skin_kol…
## $ donorOrganisms.biologicalSex     <list> "male", "male", "male", "male", <"fe…
## $ donorOrganisms.donorCount        <int> 1, 1, 1, 1, 6, 1, 6, 1, 6, 6, 1, 1, 1…
## $ donorOrganisms.id                <list> "human_skin_donor_kolf_2", "human_sk…
## $ donorOrganisms.organismAge.unit  <list> "year", "year", "year", "year", <"ye…
## $ donorOrganisms.organismAge.value <list> "55-59", "55-59", "55-59", "55-59", …
## $ donorOrganisms.organismAgeRange  <list> <1734480000, 1860624000>, <173448000…

…or invariant and reflect experiment-wide annotation

s |>
    select(where(column_is_experimentwide)) |>
    distinct() |>
    glimpse()

Data files

What types of files does the project have?

files1 <- files(project_filter)

files1 |>
    glimpse()
## Rows: 317
## Columns: 8
## $ fileId       <chr> "7cdd4ea0-89f0-40db-b412-1028a33de341", "e4448794-0d72-48…
## $ name         <chr> "6231STDY8987088_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz", "6231STDY92582…
## $ fileFormat   <chr> "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz…
## $ size         <dbl> 6125863619, 3834063816, 31342343827, 1952130119, 71352882…
## $ version      <chr> "2022-07-14T14:18:33.274000Z", "2022-07-14T14:18:31.34200…
## $ projectTitle <chr> "Robust temporal map of human in vitro myelopoiesis using…
## $ projectId    <chr> "ac289b77-fb12-4a6b-ad43-c0721c698e70", "ac289b77-fb12-4a…
## $ url          <chr> "https://service.azul.data.humancellatlas.org/repository/…

files1 |>
    count(fileFormat)
## # A tibble: 2 × 2
##   fileFormat     n
##   <chr>      <int>
## 1 fastq.gz     313
## 2 rds            4

## create `files2` with just the files needed for count-matrix
## analysis

files2 <- files1 |>
    filter(fileFormat == "rds")

Retrieve and cache locally all files needed to construct a gene x cell count matrix.

file_path <-
    files2 |>
    files_download() |>
    setNames(files2 |> pull(name))

## join file path to appropriate components of `f`
count_matrix_files1 <-
    files2 |>
    left_join(tibble(
        fileId = files2$fileId,
        local.filePath = unname(file_path)
    ), by = "fileId")

Assemble into SingleCellExperiment (to come)

We can convert the RDS files (that are Seurat objects) into SingleCellExperiment object.

rds_file_paths <- count_matrix_files1 |>
    pull(local.filePath)
dat <- readRDS(rds_file_paths[2])
sce_obj <- as.SingleCellExperiment(dat)
sce_obj
## class: SingleCellExperiment 
## dim: 20266 52492 
## metadata(0):
## assays(2): counts logcounts
## rownames(20266): AL627309.1 AL669831.5 ... ERVH48-1 AATBC
## rowData names(0):
## colnames(52492): AAACCTGAGTGGCACA-1 AAACCTGCAAAGCGGT-1 ...
##   TTTGTTGTCAAATGCC-11 TTTGTTGTCTAGAGCT-11
## colData names(23): nCount_RNA nFeature_RNA ... MediaExperiment ident
## reducedDimNames(0):
## mainExpName: SCT
## altExpNames(2): RNA integrated
